entries.title: Labour’s Starmer Looks to Private Sector to Fix Britain
entries.description: UK opposition leader Keir Starmer will put the private sector at the heart of his vision for a “decade of national renewal,” warning that a Labour government “won’t be able to spend our way out of this mess.”

entries.title: Trump’s Clout in GOP Slips as Plea for McCarthy Goes Unheeded
entries.description: Donald Trump lost his sway over the Republican Party at a crucial moment as a handful of conservatives repudiated his call for GOP lawmakers to back Kevin McCarthy’s uphill fight to become House speaker.

entries.title: Chaos Grips US House as Rules Vanish for Chamber With No Speaker
entries.description: The dysfunction playing out on the floor of the US House has quickly spilled outside the chamber as one-half of Capitol Hill has suddenly become a free-for-all.

entries.title: Biden-McConnell Comity Is Sharp Contrast to GOP’s Speaker Mayhem
entries.description: As Republican leader Kevin McCarthy fought party hardliners in a faltering bid to become US House speaker, his GOP counterpart in the Senate was almost 500 miles away from Washington — celebrating a landmark bipartisan accomplishment with the Democratic president.

entries.title: New York Urges Halt to Forced Arbitrations That Trap Foreign Nurses
entries.description: New York urged the American Arbitration Association to refuse cases from companies seeking hefty financial penalties from workers who quit their jobs, a practice the state attorney general warned can violate human-trafficking law.

entries.title: China’s Tech Giants Brace for a New Era of Slower Growth
entries.description: Beijing’s two-year crackdown has led the industry to accept stricter controls.

entries.title: SEC Pushes Back on Binance.US Deal to Buy Voyager Digital
entries.description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission is pushing back on Binance.US’s plan to buy bankrupt crypto lender Voyager Digital in a deal valued at about $1 billion, according to a bankruptcy court filing.

entries.title: Biden May Send Ukraine Bradley Armored Vehicles as War Drags On
entries.description: President Joe Biden said he’s considering sending Ukraine the US’s Bradley Fighting Vehicles to aid the country’s defense against Russia’s invasion.

entries.title: Hamlin's Injury Doesn’t Mean NFL Has Grown Too Violent, Biden Says
entries.description: President Joe Biden said the NFL should continue to improve health protections for its players, but that Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin’s collapse during a game on Monday doesn’t mean the game is too dangerous.

entries.title: College Admissions Cheating Mastermind Gets 3 1/2 Years Prison
entries.description: Rick Singer, the college-admissions consultant at the heart of the “Varsity Blues” scandal in which wealthy parents paid bribes to get their kids into elite universities, was sentenced to 3 1/2 years in prison.

entries.title: EU Urges Covid Travel Screening for Passengers From China
entries.description: European Union member states recommended new restrictions on passengers traveling into the bloc from China but stopped short of adding new rules for flights.

entries.title: One House Democrat Wants to Strike a Deal to Make McCarthy Speaker
entries.description: House Democrat Brad Sherman floated a potential deal Wednesday that would trade Democratic votes to make beleaguered Republican Kevin McCarthy the speaker of the House in return for rules aimed at preventing a US government shutdown or a debt limit crisis.

entries.title: FBI Boosts Reward for Pipe Bomb Info Ahead of Jan. 6 Anniversary
entries.description: The FBI increased the reward offered for the arrest in connection with pipe bombs left at political targets in Washington on the eve of Jan. 6, 2021.

entries.title: Santos Has Only One Thing to Say: ‘I’m Supporting the Leader’
entries.description: The now infamous George Santos, trailed by journalists in Washington, had only one thing to say Wednesday: he supports Kevin McCarthy’s flailing bid for speaker of the House.

entries.title: Trump Rape Accuser Defends NY Sex-Abuse Law She Used to Sue
entries.description: A New York writer who claims former President Donald Trump raped her in the 1990s urged a judge to uphold a new law allowing victims to sue over alleged sexual abuse that occurred decades earlier.

entries.title: Biden May Visit US-Mexico Border as Migration Surges
entries.description: President Joe Biden is considering a visit to the US-Mexico border next week, according to people familiar with the matter, for a first-hand look at conditions as his administration contends with a surge in migration.

entries.title: Key Takeaways From Minutes of Fed's December Meeting on Rates
entries.description: For Bloomberg's TOPLive blog on the Fed minutes, click here

entries.title: NY Fed Warns of Debt Crunch Coming If Biden’s Student-Loan Plan Fails
entries.description: Student borrowers in the US are struggling to keep up with other kinds of debt even while college payments are frozen, and a surge in delinquencies is likely if the government’s debt-relief plan fails, according to a new study.

entries.title: Trump Jan. 6 Subpoena Fight Fizzles Out With New Congress
entries.description: A federal judge in Florida has dismissed former President Donald Trump’s subpoena fight with the now-disbanded Jan. 6 congressional committee, an unsurprising end to an historically significant chapter of the investigation.

entries.title: Germany Urged to Expand Gas Plants to Secure Power Supply
entries.description: Gas pipes run through a plant at the Queensland Curtis Liquefied Natural Gas (QCLNG) project site, operated by QGC Pty, a unit of Royal Dutch Shell Plc, in Gladstone, Australia, on Wednesday, June 15, 2016. Gas from more than 2,500 wells travels hundreds of miles by pipeline to the project, where it's chilled and pumped into 10-story-high tanks before being loaded onto massive ships. Photographer: Patrick Hamilton /Bloomberg

entries.title: Cameroon’s Energy Subsidy Swelled to 3% of GDP Last Year
entries.description: Cameroon spent 3% of its gross domestic product subsidizing fuel and gas to curb its citizens’ rising energy costs in 2022, a share six times bigger than the previous year.

entries.title: WHO Wants More Data From China as Omicron Drives Covid Surge
entries.description: A patient is treated on a bed in a corridor of the emergency department of a hospital in Beijing on January 3, 2023. - Cities across China have struggled with surging infections, a resulting shortage of pharmaceuticals and overflowing hospital wards and crematoriums after Beijing suddenly dismantled its zero-Covid lockdown and testing regime. (Photo by Jade GAO / AFP) (Photo by JADE GAO/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Iran Summons French Envoy Over Charlie Hebdo’s Cartoons of Khamenei
entries.description: Iran’s foreign ministry summoned the French ambassador after the satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo published a series of cartoons mocking the Islamic Republic’s Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

entries.title: New Jersey Extends Disputed Contract With Health Insurer Horizon
entries.description: NEW JERSEY, USA - JANUARY 18: Governor Philip D. Murphy sworn in for his second term in office as the 56th Governor of the State of New Jersey at War Memorial Building in Trenton, New Jersey, United States on January 18, 2022. (Photo by Tayfun Coskun/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images)

entries.title: McCarthy Again Blocked in Bid for House Speaker as Conservatives Rebel
entries.description: WASHINGTON, DC - JANUARY 03: House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) speaks to reporters as he arrives to a meeting with House Republicans at the U.S. Capitol Building on January 03, 2023 in Washington, DC. Today members of the 118th Congress will be sworn in and the House of Representatives will hold votes on a new Speaker of the House. (Photo by Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images)

entries.title: Sunak’s UK Speech Promises Not as Straight-Talking as They Seem
entries.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Wednesday sought to portray himself as a straight-talking, sensible politician who the British electorate can trust.

entries.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Casts a Long Shadow on Chicago’s Mayoral Race
entries.description: Chicago mayor Lori Lightfoot is using fallen crypto executive Sam Bankman-Fried in an advertising campaign attacking her biggest opponent in this year’s election.

entries.title: McDonald’s Is Abandoning Kazakhstan as Russia’s War Spills Over
entries.description: McDonald’s Corp. is set to abandon Kazakhstan after disruptions triggered by the invasion of Ukraine left the central Asian nation without a substitute for Russian meat supplies, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak Made Five Promises. Here’s How Tough They Are to Keep
entries.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak made five promises to the British public — and wants voters to judge his government on whether those pledges are met. “No tricks, no ambiguity — we’re either delivering for you or we’re not,” Sunak said in London in his first speech of the year.

entries.title: GOP Hard-Liners Angle for Plum Posts as Price of McCarthy Votes
entries.description: Florida Republican Matt Gaetz, who was among those who questioned whether the coronavirus originated in a lab in China, wants to chair a House Armed Services subcommittee. Maryland Republican Andy Harris, one of Congress’s most conspicuous opponents of abortion and recreational marijuana, wants the gavel of the Appropriations subcommittee on health and human services. And a freshman wants two A-list committee assignments.

entries.title: Norway Court Orders Seizure of $7 Million From Russian Citizen
entries.description: A Norwegian court sanctioned the confiscation of 72 million kroner ($7.1 million) it said was laundered by a Russian citizen.

entries.title: House Chaos Deepens as GOP Seeks to Adjourn, Delay Speaker Vote
entries.description: House GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy and his lieutenants have decided to seek to adjourn the House immediately after convening at noon, rather than hold any additional votes for the next speaker, a person familiar with the plans said.

entries.title: Biden Calls GOP Struggle to Elect Speaker ‘Embarrassing’ for US
entries.description: President Joe Biden criticized Republicans for failing to elect a House Speaker, calling their public struggles an embarrassment to the country.

entries.title: Lula’s Pick for Petrobras Gains Momentum in Path to CEO
entries.description: Brazilian Senator Jean Paul Prates is advancing in his quest to become Petrobras’s next chief executive officer at a time investors are concerned about growing political interference in the oil giant.

entries.title: Pemex Talks With Finance Ministry on Debt-Payment Alternatives
entries.description: Octavio Romero Oropeza, chief executive officer of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX), speaks during a news conference with Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, Mexico's president, not pictured, at the National Palace in Mexico City, Mexico, on Tuesday, Jan. 7, 2020. Mexico's move to divert aTC Energy Corp.gas pipeline from indigenous lands is reigniting concerns over the future of energy projects in the country.

entries.title: Why Republican Holdouts Are Blocking McCarthy as Speaker — and Throwing Congress Into Chaos
entries.description: The House is at a standstill with Republicans deadlocked in a battle to elect a speaker that heads into its second day with Representative Kevin McCarthy fighting a faction of 20 conservative, anti-establishment lawmakers who say the California Republican hasn’t done enough to win their votes.

entries.title: Saudi-Backed LIV Golf Is Using PGA Suit to Get Data on 9/11 Families, Court Told
entries.description: Saudi Arabia’s LIV Golf is allegedly using its US court fight with rival PGA Tour Inc. to “build an intelligence file” on families of 9/11 victims who have been critical of the kingdom and its new professional golfer’s circuit.

entries.title: Chicago Rolls Out Campaign to Lure Employers After Citadel, Boeing Exits
entries.description: Chicago is taking new steps to lure companies to the region after high-profile corporate departures rocked the city last year.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak Hints at Change in Approach to Striking Workers
entries.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak hinted the government may take a softer line against striking workers as he delivered a speech setting out his government’s priorities.

entries.title: Iran Releases Film Star Who Was Jailed for Backing Protests
entries.description: Iranian actor Taraneh Alidoosti was released on bail from a Tehran prison after she was jailed last month for publicly criticizing the Islamic Republic’s suppression of widespread anti-government protests.

entries.title: Sunak Pledges to Cut Debt, Halve Inflation in Crisis-Hit UK
entries.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak pledged to reduce the national debt and cut inflation as he set out his priorities for the coming year against a backdrop of mounting strikes, a creaking National Health Service and dire poll ratings for his ruling Conservative Party.

entries.title: Fed’s Kashkari Favors Raising Rates Another Point, Then Pausing
entries.description: Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said the US central bank has at least another percentage point of interest-rate increases to do in 2023 even as inflation is showing signs of reversing.

entries.title: China’s Central Bank Pledges ‘Targeted, Prudent’ Monetary Policy
entries.description: China’s central bank reiterated it will implement a targeted and prudent monetary policy in 2023, and provide support to domestic demand.

entries.title: The Graft Scandal That Could Undercut the EU’s Soft Power
entries.description: Whether it’s going after shady Russian oligarchs or chiding governments for failing to tackle corruption, one of the European Union’s most potent weapons is its own record in fighting graft closer to home. So it’s no surprise that the bloc’s critics are making the most of a bribery scandal at the European Parliament involving lurid revelations of suitcases stuffed with cash. The case centers on just a handful of people at the 705-member assembly, but could still undercut the EU’s soft power.

entries.title: Trump Urges GOP to Back McCarthy With Speakership Bid Faltering
entries.description: Former US President Donald Trump urged the conservative House members to back beleaguered Representative Kevin McCarthy for speaker of the House, one day after McCarthy failed to secure enough support in three humiliating rounds of voting.

entries.title: Trump Calls On House Republicans to Vote for McCarthy as Speaker
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump says “really good conversations” took place last night and that it’s time for all House Republicans to vote for Kevin McCarthy to be speaker, Bloomberg News reports.

entries.title: Chevron CEO Defends Record Profits as ‘Modest Return’ Over Time
entries.description: Oil major was losing billions just three years ago, Wirth says

entries.title: Xi and Marcos Agree to Boost Ties, Consult on Maritime Issues
entries.description: The presidents of China and the Philippines agreed to strengthen cooperation and discuss maritime differences amicably after meeting in Beijing on Wednesday, according to Chinese state media.

entries.title: Ukraine Nuclear Chief Sees Seizure of ‘Atomic Pearl’ From Russia
entries.description: Ukraine must seize Europe’s biggest nuclear power plant back from Russia by force as efforts to establish a security zone around it evaporate, Kyiv’s top nuclear official said.

entries.title: UK Set to Withdraw Plan to Privatize State-Owned Channel 4
entries.description: The UK is backing away from a proposal to privatize state-owned broadcaster Channel Four Television Corp., according to two people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Chaos Greets Republican Control of US House
entries.description: Republican Kevin McCarthy’s drive to become speaker of the US House of Representatives suffered a once-in-a-century humiliation as opposition by ultraconservatives in his own party denied him a majority in three rounds of voting.

entries.title: Liz Truss Warns Rishi Sunak Not to Shelve Childcare Reform Plans
entries.description: Rishi Sunak has been warned by his predecessor Liz Truss not to ditch her childcare reforms, amid reports that the Prime Minister is moving to shelve the plans.

entries.title: Kosovo Barricades Cleared But Situation Still Fragile, EU Says
entries.description: NATO peacekeepers helped remove road blocks in Kosovo that ethnic Serbs had erected in their weeks-long standoff with the largely ethnic-Albanian authorities.

entries.title: Dubai Rolls Out $8.7 Trillion Economic Plan for Next Decade
entries.description: Dubai set out a 32 trillion-dirham ($8.7 trillion) economic plan on Wednesday that includes doubling foreign trade and investment over the next decade to boost its standing as a global financial hub.

entries.title: Former Biden Spokesman Kamau Marshall Moving to Education Department From USTR
entries.description: Kamau Marshall, a former chief campaign spokesman for Joe Biden’s 2020 presidential campaign, moved from the US Trade Representative to the Education Department this week.

entries.title: France Prepares Green Industry Bill Echoing US Climate Law
entries.description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said he will present a “green industry” bill soon as Europe seeks to stop businesses being lured across the Atlantic by billions of dollars of subsidies under the US’s climate law.

entries.title: Union Boss Says UK Rail Strike Talks to Resume Next Week
entries.description: One of the UK’s biggest unions accused the government of waiting until after this week’s crippling rail strikes before resuming talks over pay and working conditions.

entries.title: Russia Ups Death Toll in Ukraine Strike, Blames Cell-Phone Use
entries.description: Russia raised the death toll in a Ukrainian rocket attack on New Year’s Day, to 89, the largest such loss it’s yet acknowledged in the war, blaming soldiers’ mobile-phone use for exposing their location.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Germany Sees Little Hope of Peace Coming Soon
entries.description: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said there’s little sign that Russian President Vladimir Putin plans to end his war on Ukraine anytime soon “despite all international efforts.”

entries.title: Key Italian Minister Questions ECB Independence From Governments
entries.description: A key minister in Giorgia Meloni’s right-wing administration has called into question the legitimacy of the European Central Bank’s independence from national governments and European Union authorities.

entries.title: Japan to Step Up Border Curbs on Visitors From China on Jan. 8
entries.description: Japan will require more stringent Covid-19 testing from Sunday on visitors coming from China, risking further irritating its neighbor as it tries to prevent a sharp increase in cases that could put new strains on its medical system.

entries.title: Japan’s Kishida Urges Firms to Raise Wages Faster Than Inflation
entries.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said he would push firms for pay increases that exceed the inflation rate, as his government struggles with the country’s highest price rises in four decades.

entries.title: Malaysia to Tighten Covid Screening For All Arrivals, PM Says
entries.description: Malaysia will tighten screening rules for all foreign arrivals, Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said, amid concerns about the rampant Covid outbreak in China.

entries.title: China Warplane Flights Near Taiwan Surged in 2022 Amid Tensions
entries.description: The number of incursions China’s warplanes made into a sensitive area around Taiwan nearly doubled in 2022 compared to a year earlier, a sign of increased tensions over the democratically run island.

entries.title: Hong Kong’s Isolation Estimated to Cost Economy $27 Billion
entries.description: Hong Kong’s economy lost an estimated $27 billion in potential growth due to the effects of the pandemic and the city’s strict Covid curbs, according to Natixis SA.

entries.title: China Discussing Easing of Ban on Australia Coal Imports
entries.description: Chinese bureaucrats are discussing plans to resume some imports of Australian coal after a more than two-year ban as relations between the nations improve.

entries.title: Twitter to Ease Political Ads Ban Under Musk
entries.description: Twitter Inc. will relax a three-year ban on political advertising in a continued policy shift after its takeover by billionaire Elon Musk.

entries.title: Battered by Covid, China Hits Pause on Giant Chip Spending Aimed at Rivaling US
entries.description: China is pausing massive investments aimed at building a chip industry to compete with the US, as a nationwide Covid resurgence strains the world’s No. 2 economy and Beijing’s finances.

entries.title: New Zealand Won’t Seek Negative Covid Test for China Travelers
entries.description: New Zealand has no plans to require visitors from China to provide a negative Covid-19 test, saying there is minimal public health risk to the South Pacific nation.

entries.title: McCarthy’s Speaker Ambitions Suffer Blow as He Loses Three Votes
entries.description: Kevin McCarthy saw his longtime ambition of becoming US House speaker slipping from his grasp after a humiliating showdown with a stubborn conservative minority that laid bare divisions among Republicans and foreshadowed legislative gridlock for the next two years.

entries.title: Biden to Meet With Japan’s Kishida at White House Next Week
entries.description: President Joe Biden will welcome Japanese Prime Minister Kishida Fumio to the White House on Jan. 13, as Japan looks to bolster its defense capabilities amid North Korean missile tests and Chinese military drills that have stoked concern across the Pacific.

entries.title: Santos Sits Alone as Resignation Calls Mount Over His Lies
entries.description: George Santos cut a lonely figure on his first formal day in Washington as a newly elected Republican congressman from New York.
